text:
A Game of Wits

Dimly lit room, tense atmosphere  
The hunt is on.  
Porfiry: “It’s crucial to know a man’s side.”  

Porfiry: “Nerves, my friend! They’re all sick and irritable!”  

Porfiry: “Let him roam free! He won’t escape me.”  

---

Dark room, Raskolnikov is tense  
A predator watches its prey.  
Porfiry: “He’s psychologically trapped, like a butterfly!”  

Porfiry: “He’ll circle closer, then—flop! I’ll swallow him!”  

Raskolnikov: *silent, pale, eyes locked on Porfiry*

**PAGE SUMMARY:** The speaker expresses confidence in capturing a man psychologically, believing he will inevitably succumb to pressure and reveal himself.
